Thomas Howell, Patrick Read Johnson', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, AC-3, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 17 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 1, 2016', 'Actors': 'Kelsey Sanders, Fred Thompson, Ernest Borgnine, Louise Fletcher, Jerry Zandstra', 'Studio': 'Entertainment One', 'Number of discs': '1'}
This is a sleeper that would enlighten all who watch. Time well spent with family...especially teens. An every family must have.
Amazing facts you must know
Rick Steves The Holy Land: Director's Cut DVD
Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD
['Product Description', 'Experience the Holy Land with Rick Steves.', 'In this hour-long special, Rick Steves weaves together both the Israeli and the Palestinian narratives to better understand a place that is, for a third of humanity, literally holy land. The crossroads for three great religions, the Holy Land has been coveted and fought over for centuries. Dining with both Jews and Muslims, we realize the menu is essentially the same, whether in Hebrew or Arabic. While visiting the big sights, we delve deeper to better understand and empathize with both peoples. In Israel, we go from the venerable ramparts of Jerusalem to the vibrant modern skyline of Tel Aviv. In Palestine, by harvesting olives near Hebron, visiting a home in Bethlehem, and popping into a university in Ramallah, we get to know a land few tourists visit. And all along the way, we learn about security walls, disputed settlements, and the persistent challenges facing the region as Israelis and Palestinians learn to live together.', "Director's Cut DVD", "This special director's cut features an extended version of the original 1-hour public television special—plus a commentary track featuring Rick Steves and director Simon Griffith.", 'Bonus Features', 'Q&A with Rick StevesExtended interviewsBonus Disc:', "Rick Steves' Iran", 'Review', 'What public television viewers are saying about the', 'Rick Steves The Holy Land', 'special:', '"I was entranced the whole hour." –Anne, OETA viewer"[', 'The Holy Land', '] was excellent. Thank you for showing so many aspects of the people and the problems they are facing."– Mary Anne, WTTW viewer"', 'The Holy Land', 'is one of the fairest and insightful looks at modern Palestine and Israel I have ever seen." –Chris, KCTS viewer"Impressive ability to remain factual and nonjudgmental. Everyone who cares about peace in this region needs to see', 'The Holy Land', '." –Carolyn, KLRU viewer"It was just really captivating. My whole family watched it and we all loved it. It was so interesting to see how life is there without the filters of the corporate media. I can really say I learned quite a bit from watching that show." –Brian, KET viewer"Thank you, Rick, for your balanced presentation." –Matt, OPB viewer"Excellent! Thanks for showing both sides of the issue." –Anita, GPB viewer"', 'The Holy Land', 'was awesome and well done. Thank you!" –Doug, WFYI viewer"What a wonderful experience! We learned so much." –Marylou, WCNY viewer"I have learned more about Israel and Palestine than I ever have with anyone else! Fabulous and so balanced." –Barbara, NPT viewer"Thanks, Rick, for an unbiased, remarkable, well-written Holy Land special. Truly unique and engaging." –Beca, KBYU viewer']

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Interests:** The user maintains a strong focus on family-oriented drama films, engaging documentaries, and educational children's content, while increasingly exploring suspense and action genres. They value quality storytelling that conveys meaningful themes.

- **Content Type:** Emphasizing material with enlightening messages suitable for all audiences, the user continues to appreciate suspenseful narratives and classic detective themes, alongside well-balanced documentaries.

- **Rating Behavior:** The user’s critical evaluation style remains evident, rating content notably for its informative value. Their recent interactions suggest a growing enthusiasm for cerebral storytelling and diverse narratives, although they displayed some disappointment with a recent film featuring acclaimed actors.

- **Social Influences:** Family viewing remains central, with an emphasis on entertainment that offers educational value during group gatherings. They highly value recommendations that provoke meaningful discussions.

- **Genre Preference:** While drama is still their main focus, the user is actively shifting toward suspense and action films, ensuring suitability for younger audiences remains a priority.

- **Engagement Style:** Their thoughtful reviews highlight wholesome content and admiration for prominent actors. Recent interactions underscore sustained engagement across genres, especially in suspense and drama, while upholding a commitment to family-friendly themes. The user’s latest review indicates a more critical approach, signaling a discerning taste in their exploration of new content.
